attributes.action: Secure a Brexit deal before December 31 2020
attributes.additional_details: The governor of the Bank of England, Andrew Bailey, has told MPs on the Commons Treasury committee that the economic cost of a no-deal Brexit would cause more long term damage than Covid-19. It is not enough for the chancellor to hope that the UK will “prosper in any eventuality” if there is no deal before the December 31 deadline — the livelihoods, health and career prospects of millions of Britons depend on it. 2020 has brought increased child poverty and left a generation of young people out in the cold: Britain deserves a deal.
attributes.background: The Covid-19 crisis plunged Britain’s economy into the deepest recession on record, but a no-deal Brexit will be even more harmful to the UK’s future prosperity. The UK Government needs to act now to secure a Brexit deal before the transitional arrangements come to an end on December 31.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Government is already undertaking negotations for a deal.  You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
